textBeforeTable: List of illume keyboards Sliding right over the keyboard sends a space Sliding left over the keyboard sends a backspace With "q" keyboard: lists all possible words in order to choose the right one Tapping the upper-left key "Abc" during the composition of a word Sliding right over the keyboard sends the composed word Sliding left over the keyboard deletes the last entered key With "a" keyboard: Tapping the upper-left key "Abc" lists the available dictionaries Tapping the upper-right key ("a", "1" or "q") lists the available keyboards Sliding up over any keyboard switches to the next keyboard Sliding down over any keyboard sends Enter How to use (Raster's) keyboard? If this does not work for your installation: See Keyboard Toggle or change /etc/enlightenment/default_profile to point to the illume profile instead of asu. Troubleshoting Then switch keyboard from "None" to "Default" in Illume's preferences. /etc/init.d/xserver-nodm restart  Restart X  rm -rf ~/.e/e/config/illume  Purge E's cache  Add it if it is not there.  export QTOPIA_NO_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD=1  Edit /etc/X11/Xsession.d/89qtopia and set  Turn off built-in qtopia keyboard:  opkg install illume-config illume-config-illume  Make sure you have installed illume-config
textAfterTable: Icons are created by hand in a 25x25 PNG with the GIMP according to color picker values of flags in Wikipedia. The reason for this is, that no rescaling or ant-alias artifacts will emerge in this small raster. Subsequently, import this in Inkscape and type the characters. Note that for keyboard layout that are not connected to a single particular country, like Persian, no flag backgrouns is needed. Each character is typed twice in Arial Black or bold Arial. For alphanumeric, use the ABC of that language, for 'QWERTY' use the 6 first characters on the top row, note that for languages that read from richt to left is to use 'first'/last 6 characters on the right side. One characters is white with a black border of 0.5 and one is black without border but with a blur of 15 (see CTRL+SHIFT+F slider at the bottom). Reposition the whole lot and put everything in the correct layer. Export a 25x25 PNG with the background bitmap, which is also the selected export area, and you are done. Here is a video of this procedure. TODO: Rasterman, can you verify this and improve this procedure where needed? Especially improve details on which font to use and which Gaussian blur to use. How to install a new Keyboard Layout copy or download the kbd File to /usr/lib/enlightenment/modules/illume/keyboards issue the command: 'killall -HUP enlightenment' if that
